channel.title: Help? Heap memory (client side and pictures)
channel.description:
I got this error after adding modicons and to my cache and sprites folder...What I need too do?
What I changed to try to fix this [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2zxwosj.png[/img]
What the error is..It stops at "media" [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/2v0e9hl.png[/img]
Thanks for your guys help

item.title: Help? Heap memory (client side and pictures)
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

you’re going to have to create the methods to draw the icons (or simply loop through all of them and draw them depending on input for which one when needed)

but that’s not what i’m referring to.

generally, most clients have an array for the archive size/index. (in most cases modIcons[])

try to find out the variable name, and increase the size (if you used to have 2 crowns (mod/admin, they should have been entitled 0/1 in the cache itself (using cache suite), if it was in fact only two images, the archive index should have been set to a size of 1(in java, counting always starts with 0, so an array[0] = the first index) so try looking around for this array/index/size)) you will simply increase the size by changing the number [number] to (actual size-1 || as the counting starts from 0; 14 images is actually [13])

i hope this information helps.

Read full topic
item.source: Help? Heap memory (client side and pictures)

item.title: Help? Heap memory (client side and pictures)
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

wait no its L4

Vain_:

did you change the last number to be 14?

if(anInt863 == 2) method77(((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1) (aClass30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1_Sub2_1126)).aString1506, 2, "@cr2@" + aClass30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1_Sub2_1126.aString1703, aBoolean991); else if(anInt863 == 1) method77(((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1) (aClass30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1_Sub2_1126)).aString1506, *2*, "@cr1@" + aClass30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1_Sub2_1126.aString1703, aBoolean991); else method77(((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1) (aClass30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1_Sub2_1126)).aString1506, *2*, aClass30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1_Sub2_1126.aString1703, aBoolean991); if(anInt1287 == 2) {

Now i found this code in my client.java and wonder you think I need to change the 2? (I put *s to help you out to find it

Read full topic

item.title: Help? Heap memory (client side and pictures)
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

yeah, you cache packed them.

you need to go to the code (client.java should hold it)

search for modIcons

find the array index size and increase it

item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

Vain_:

did you edit the code any, or only add images?

I went into the cache’s images—>went to mod_icons–>add 1 img–>tested it…it worked–>added a img for mod_icon 1—>clicked the plus sign and added the other imgs—>saved it all—>started client–>Error

item.title: Help? Heap memory (client side and pictures)
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

Host Gushers:

my friend had this problem, u need to get rid of some stuff on your computer.

what you mean? Why would i need to do this from adding only 13 imgs files to my sprites folder and adding and 13 image files to my cache

[quote=“Ambokile, post:6, topic:521019”][quote author=MrFun link=topic=639528.msg4310505#msg4310505 date=1370659988]

You’re giving it too much memory so it’s running out. Give it less, 1024m should be more than enough.

Well changed it back to 1024m and still have same error

Try 502m.

didn’t work and btw why we lowering the number? I think the -Xmx is not even the answer to this error
[/quote]

Because your server shouldn’t need 3Gb of ram.[/quote]
found out the problem…its the cache. I add the imgs in the mod_icon section in my cache, but When I restored my cahce it went back to normal…how do I fix this?

Read full topic
item.source: Help? Heap memory (client side and pictures)

item.title: Help? Heap memory (client side and pictures)
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:6, topic:521019”][quote author=MrFun link=topic=639528.msg4310505#msg4310505 date=1370659988]

You’re giving it too much memory so it’s running out. Give it less, 1024m should be more than enough.

Well changed it back to 1024m and still have same error

Try 502m.

didn’t work and btw why we lowering the number? I think the -Xmx is not even the answer to this error
[/quote]

Because your server shouldn’t need 3Gb of ram.[/quote]
:eek: , so what you think i should do now…since its not working?

Read full topic

Well changed it back to 1024m and still have same error

Try 502m.
[/quote]
didn’t work and btw why we lowering the number? I think the -Xmx is not even the answer to this error[/quote]

Because your server shouldn’t need 3Gb of ram.
